title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park              Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:5 minutes, 36 seconds  Get to know Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park through the history, nature, and the people who care for it.     Â    The Klondike Gold Rush was a great human drama that captured the attention of the world, and brought many people to settle Alaska and the Yukon. Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park preserves the trails, historic structures, artifacts, landscapes, and stories associated with the Klondike Gold Rush of 1897-1898.     Learn more about your park  What was the Klondike Gold Rush? Dive in to history with Skagway's Historic District Earn your Junior Ranger or Deputy Ranger badge Explore gold rush artifacts that have been collected or excavated Discover what plants and animals make the northern Lynn Canal their homes Research how a historical park investigates the landscapes that hosted this historic event Brochures & Publications can be downloaded for extra information
